Kimberly is one of the members of the Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo [Woman Looking for Success Bank], is twenty six years old, and lives with her husband. She has only been married a short time, and has many goals she wishes to achieve, so she works very hard to make them a reality. She does not have children yet because she wants to finish her higher education and improve her economic condition to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.
This is the second loan she has requested from Fundación Mujer, and is very happy with the services it provides her. She will use the loan to purchase shoes, which are what she sells in the Talamanca region where she lives.
The loan is of great help to her since it has allowed her to have a variety of shoes available, increase her sales, and generate extra revenue to help her husband cover housing costs.
In the group with Kimberly are Yolanda, Berta, Delia, and Jeanneth, who will invest in commercial activities and raising chickens.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con su negocio de administración y atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja de lunes a sabados en su tienda de abarrotes, ella también esta entrando en la artesanía, la socia esta aprendiendo el negocio del arte en especial en la artesanía como ceniceros, silvatos, adornos hechos en arcilla y pintados con oxidos naturales. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y de panetones para las fiesta navideñas y un poco invertir en la compra de artesanía hecha para la venta y ver si este nuevo negocio le renta.
texts.en: The member currently continues with her business administering and tending to her grocery store. She works from Monday to Saturday in her store, and is also beginning to get into handicrafts. She is learning the business of art, especially handicrafts like ashtrays, whistles, and ornaments made from clay and painted with natural oxide paints. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase staple products and fruitcakes for Christmas time, as well as a little bit to be able to purchase handicrafts made to be sold and see if this new business proves profitable for her.

loans.use: to stock her store and a little bit to invest in purchasing handicrafts.

loans.name: Elvia Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Elvia Argentina, de 65 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 32 y 40 años de edad, Dos hijos viven en los Estados Unidos  y uno vive con ella y dos nietas,  de 6 y 10 años de edad, quienes están estudiando en la escuela. Ella es madre soltera, vive en la aldea Terencio Sierra de Tela,  Atlántida. 
Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada para damas y niños, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y accesorios para damas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa, desde hace 5 años. Anteriormente   trabajaba como cocinera en hoteles, restaurante y mercados.  Luego uno de sus hijos comenzó enviándole ropa y zapatos de los EE.UU en pequeñas cantidades y al ver que los vendía fue surtiendo de mas productos, y  ya tiene sus clientes que le hacen encargos. 
Le dedica tiempo completo el viernes y el sábado porque son los días en que sus clientes cuentan con dinero.
Ha solicitado un préstamo a ODEF para comprar ropa nueva y perfumes para tener más surtido el negocio.
Su plan es obtener un local para establecer este negocio con la ayuda de los financiamientos y con las ganancias lograr que sus nietas culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elvia Argentina is 65 years old.  She has three children; ages 23, 32, and 40.  Two of her children live in the United States.  The other child lives with her and her two grandchildren, ages six and ten.  The grandchildren are in school.  She is a single mother, and she lives in the village of Terencio Sierra de Tela, Atlántida.

She sells women’s and children’s clothes, shoes, perfume, creams, and women’s accessories.  She has had the business in her house for five years.  She previously worked as a cook in hotels, restaurants, and markets.  Then, one of her children started sending her small quantities of clothes and shoes  from the United States.  Upon seeing that they sold, she stocked up on more products.  She now has customers who order from her.  She works full time on Fridays and Saturdays because those are the days that her customers have money.

She has requested a loan from ODEF to buy new clothes and perfume.  She will do this in order to have more stock for her business.  Her plan is to get a place to establish her business.  With the help from the loans and with her earnings she will manage to have her granddaughters complete their education.

loans.use: to stock her business with new clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La socia tiene entre todas sus actividades la venta de quinua en granos, en otras ocasiones y a pedido venta de ollas, venta de frazadas y normalmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogos todo el año, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea poder ahorrar dinero para invertir en la educación de su hijo y poder darle mejor calidad de vida, ella en esta ocasión desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de granos de quinua al por mayor por kintales, en la compra de frazadas para la venta al por menor y en la compra de ollas para la venta en el mes de diciembre.
texts.en: The member includes among her business activities the sale of quinoa grains, at other times and to order the sale of pots and blankets. She usually sells beauty products by catalogue throughout the year. The member is a hardworking woman and wants to save money to invest in her child's education and be able to give the child a better quality of life. This time she wants the loan to invest in buying quinoa grain in bulk by the quintal (1 quintal equals 100lb), blankets for retail sale and pots to sell in December.

loans.use: to buy quinoa in bulk, blankets for retail sale and pots to sell in December.

loans.name: Neyza

texts.es: Neyza tiene 25 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Viven en compañía de su pareja y de su menor hijo, en su casa que es propia, que construyó con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza, es la compra y venta de madera sobrante. Por tal razón se levanta muy temprano con su pareja y en su furgoneta rumbo a los aserraderos en donde compran la madera que no son utilizados para su fabricación. Luego es vendido en talleres de carpintería, muchos de estos entregas ya son pedidos y otra parte tienen que buscar a quien vender. Tiene dos años dedicándose a esta actividad y hasta el momento le ha ido bien en el negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que le genera un ingreso económico y con ello satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Sin embargo es un trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo es por ello que su pareja la ayuda. Este sería el crédito número tres con la institución MFP, y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más madera en mayor cantidad y a un menor precio para tener más ganancias.
texts.en: Neyza is 25 years old and is a friendly and enterprising woman. She lives with her partner and youngest child in her own house which she built with her partner's help. She buys and sells scrap wood. For this reason she gets up very early with her partner and in their van heads to the sawmills to buy the wood not used for manufacturing. Subsequently, this is sold to carpentry workshops; many of these deliveries are to fill orders. For the rest they have to find buyers. She has been doing this work for 2 years and up until now she is doing well with the business. What she likes about her business is that it generates an income and thus meets the needs of her family. However, it is a job that requires a lot of effort which is why her partner helps her. This would be her 3rd loan with MFP and so she hopes to receive the support of all of you so as to continue with her work. With the amount requested, she will buy more wood in greater quantities and at a lower price to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more wood.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es: Marlith tiene 55 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre. Viven en compañía de su pareja, su hija, su yerno y su nieto en su casa que es propia. Se siente muy contenta de poder tener cerca a su familia a los que quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Marlith es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para lo cual abrió un bodega en su propia casa. Desde entonces su establecimiento esta abierto todo el día atendiendo a su clientela. Se siente muy contenta con su negocio, por la clientela que tiene, quienes siempre le compran sus productos. Tiene seis meses dedicándose a esta actividad, y considera rentable ya que gracias a ello percibe ganancias, lo cual lo deriva para los gastos del hogar. Asimismo su yerno también apoya en la economía, de esa manera pueden vivir comodamente. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, sabe que ésto solo se puede lograr a base de trabajo constante y dedicación. Este sería el crédito número once con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con su grupo comunal, por el tiempo que tiene conoce muy bien a la mayoría con las cuales tiene una estrecha amistad y se apoyan entre si. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará más productos de primera necesidad y al por mayor para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Marlith is 55 years old. She is a cheerful and determined woman who lives in her own house with her partner, her daughter, her son-in-law and grandson. She very happy to have her family and loved ones close by. Marlith sells staple products to which end she opened a store in her own house. Since then the business is open all day serving customers. She is very happy with her business, for the cuctomers she has who always buy her products. She has been doing this work for 6 months and thinks it is profitable as it has resulted in profits which are used for household expenses. Her son-in-law also supports the household economy and in this way they can live comfortably. Her greatest desire is to expand her business. She knows that this can only be achieved through consistent hard work and dedication. This would be her 11th loan with the institution MFP. She feels comfortable with her communal bank group. She has known most of them a while and has a close friendship with them and they support each other. With the requested loan, she will buy more staple products wholesale to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con el negocio familiar de la venta de materiales de construcción, la socia vende por ejemplo, arena, ormigon, grama, cemento, ladrillos, fierros, bloqueta entre otros materiales, la socia también aprovecha de su poder de convencimiento y se esta dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza a sus amistades y en general por catalogos, ella trabaja con dos lineas muy conocidas en el país y reparte sus catalogos le piden los productos y ella les da los productos a sus amistades, la socia es aún estudiante de la carrera de Psicología en la misma universidad y esta avanzando mucho y pronto obtendra su grado. La socia en esta ocasión también requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como arena, cemento, grama para implementar el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
The member (Grecia) continues working in the family business of selling building materials. She sells for examples, sand, concrete, grass, cement bricks, iron, blocks and other items. 

The member also takes advantage of her power of persuasion by selling beauty products to her friends from catalogs, working with two well known brands in her country. She passes out her catalogs and they order the goods and she gives her friends the products. 

The member is still at the same university as a Psychology student and is making good progress and will soon attain her degree. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy materials such as sand, cement, and grass in order to carry out the family business.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and grass in order to carry out the family business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood (fish and shrimp).

loans.name: Santos Natividad

texts.es:
La  Señora Santos Natividad, tiene 53 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo en  la Comunidad del Triunfo de la Cruz en  el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Inicio su negocio hace dos años motivada por la necesidad de obtener ingresos que le  permitieran afrontar los gastos de su hogar. 
Comenta que fue escogida en su comunidad para la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos, lo que ella considero como una buena oportunidad.
Con el interés de realizar un pedido mayor de productos, ella ha solicitado su primer crédito el cual será invertido en la compra de: lociones, cremas aromáticas, desodorantes y acondicionadores para el cabello.
Su mayor deseo es tener más clientes y obtener mayores ganancias las cuales piensa invertir en surtir más su negocio
texts.en:
Santos Natividad is 53 years old, and she has three children.  She lives with her husband in the Triunfo de la Cruz community in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.

She started her business two years ago.  She was motivated by the necessity to get income that would allow her to pay for the household expenses.  She says that she was selected to sell cosmetics by catalog in her community.  She considered this to be a good opportunity.

Interested in making a larger order of products, she has requested her first loan.  She will use the loan to buy lotions, scented creams, deodorants, and hair conditioners.

Her greatest wish is to have more customers and to get more income.  She will use the income to stock her business more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (lotions, creams, and deodorants, etc.).

loans.name: 06.06.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh is 34 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Oanh lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Đông Vệ solidarity group. 

Mrs. Oanh has experience as a seamstress. Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines for tailoring and clothing repair. In 2010, Oanh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Oanh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailoring and clothing repair.

loans.name: María Elida

texts.es:
La  Señora María Elida, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, ella reside en  la Comunidad del Triunfo de la Cruz en  el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Vive con sus 4 hijos, su madre y un hermano. La actividad económica a que se dedica es a la venta de ropa usada. 
Ella inicio su negocio con el apoyo de un familiar que le enviaba ropa usada desde Los Estados Unidos. Luego con las ganancias comenzó a comprar más ropa para la venta.
Doña Maria Elida ha solicitado un prestamos para continuar con su negocio, ella piensa comprar un fardo de ropa variada (camisetas, ropa de niños, blusas, etc.) y así poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
Se siente motivada a seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia, apoyar el estudio de sus hijos y surtir bien su negocio.
texts.en:
María Elida, age 35, is a single mother with four children.  She lives in the Triunfo de la Cruz community in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.  She lives with her four children, her mother, and a brother.  She sells used clothes.

She started her business with the help of a relative who sent her used clothes from the United States.  She later used her income to buy more clothes to sell.

María Elida has requested a loan to continue with her business.  She plans to buy a bundle of various clothes (shirts, children’s clothes, and blouses, etc.).  That way she will be able to offer her customers variety.

She is motivated to continue working in order to help her family, to support her children’s education, and to stock her business well.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is 47 years old and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. 

Teresita started a business venture selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. 

Teresita requested a loan of 5,000.00 to pay for the cost of harvesting crabs. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Teresita wants to build a house and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of harvesting crabs.

loans.name: Nazer Anthony

texts.en:
Nazer Anthony lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Phillippines. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children. 

Nazer Anthony owns a shop, where he sells goods such as noodles, biscuits, and canned goods. He has operated this business for a year. He requested a loan of PHP 40000 to purchase additional stock. 

Nazer Anthony has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, such as noodles, biscuits, and canned goods

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with six children. She is 39 years old and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. 

Alicia started a business venture selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 4,000.00 to pay for the cost of harvesting crabs. Alicia has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Alicia wants to expand her business and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of harvesting crabs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married with 2 children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lilia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 12,500 to purchase baby pigs and feed. Lilia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Lilia hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs and feed for fattening them.

loans.name: 06.07.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make wine.

Xuân is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 7.1 Đông Vệ solidarity group. 
Xuân lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xuân hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make wine.

loans.name: Gina Helen

texts.en:
Gina Helen is 44-years-old and lives in Mansabay Bajo,Lopez Jaena. She is married with one children. 

To earn a living, Gina Helen has a business of selling of sausage. She earns about PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. Gina Helen has requested a loan to purchase dozens of sausage to sell.

Gina Helen has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Gina Helen would like to invest other type of business for additional sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of sausage to sell.

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: 06.07.03 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lan has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to resell. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lan is 41-years-old and she is married with 3 children. Lan lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 03 Đông Vệ solidarity group. 


In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Lan hopes for her children to find good jobs, to repair her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to resell.

loans.name: Abilia

texts.en:
Abilia is 62-years-old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor. Siquijor.  She is married with 7 children.

Abilia sells firewood to earn a living.  She earns, PHp 1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.00 to purchase more firewood to sell.

Abilia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Abilia would like to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is married with 4 children. Ana Maria is 45-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Ana Maria owns and operates a business venture, selling wood and wood-related products in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earns 4,000.00 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to pay for the cost of canvassing supplies  and delivery.

Ana Maria has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ana Maria hopes to finish the education of her children and to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of canvassing supplies and delivery.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: 06.11.06-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh has a stall selling household appliances. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more household appliances to resell. The main harship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thanh is 43-years-old and she is married with 4 children. Thanh lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thanh is the group leader of the 06 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and to buy more land.

loans.use: to purchase more household appliances to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. She has a sewing business from which she earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase more sewing materials. 

Marina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: 06.07.10 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Oanh is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Mrs Oanh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future. With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to remodel her house.
Oanh is the group leader of the 10 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2010, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 78 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children. She grows rice, earning approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice plantation. 

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to save money for when she is older.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice plantation

loans.name: 08.07.11- Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Mrs Hiền has a manufacturing business making stone furniture. Hiền has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make stone furniture to sell.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 11 Đông Vệ solidarity group. In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Hiền hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase material to make stone furniture to sell.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 58 years old and is married with six children. He describes himself as a “jolly person,” who is a farmer in the village of Disimuray, which is in the province of Isabela. He is enjoying the daily activities related to his farm business. He has been in this business for 20 years and earned approximately PHP 30,000 with his last crop.

According to Dominador, through the income he generated from his business, he has been able to give his child, who is currently in school, a daily allowance. His wife is busy managing their hog-raising business for additional income. They both work hard to provide a good quality of life for their children and lift them from poverty.

Dominador seeks a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings and pay for the labor needed to plant his corn farm. He hopes to raise the requested amount to further the development of his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings and pay for the labor needed to plant his farm

loans.name: 01.05.02 Đông Sơn Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hiền is 52 years old and married with one child.

Hiền is the group leader of the 02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hiền hopes to remodel her house, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with five children. Helen is 40-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Helen owns & operates a business selling wood & wood-related products in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for the business.

Helen has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Helen hopes her children finish their studies and she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the business

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is married with two adult children. She is 57 years of age and resides at Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Venancia is in the agricultural business, planting & harvesting flowers for sale to earn a living. This is the primary business of Ms. Venancia. She has been in this business for two years. Venancia is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers.

Venancia became a member of GDMPC in October 2011. Her future plan is to acquire another flower farm, because for now she has only three slots.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan is 25 years old and has been an employee at a printing company since 2002.  The job has provided enough income to live day to day since he was 18.  He was even able to buy a motorbike on credit.  Additionally, it has enabled him to support his parents.  However, he has not been able to have any savings from it and now he wants to get married.  He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to pay for the wedding expenses.  

Someday he hopes to have enough money to open his own printing business rather than continue to be an employee.  He would also like to help his parents open a grocery store in the future so they can have their own income.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is a married woman with two children. Avelina is 50 years old and she lives in the Philippines. Avelina operates a retail store and sells a variety of products in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to resell. Avelina has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Avelina wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is happily married and blessed with three school-age children. She lives is Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living, Irenia manages her agricultural business, planting and harvesting flowers for sale. In their villages, most of the people are engaged in this line of business. This is the primary source of living for Ms. Irenia.

She has been in this business for three years. She has a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Irenia is in need of financial assistance for her flower farm. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipments needed.

Irenia became a member of GDMPC this month only. Irenia plans that in the future, her business will be more productive so she can get a good return.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.  She runs a restaurant to earn a living, from which she earns about PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her business.

Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her business

loans.name: 03.5.89-Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phúc operates a food stall selling cake. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make cake to sell.

Phúc is 59 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 89 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2007, Phúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phúc has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phúc has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phúc hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make cake to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is a 50-year old married man with three children who lives in the Philippines. He owns and operates farm land, planting crops to earn a living. He's been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,500 PHP per month. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Vicente has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, he wants to build a house and finish educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for his crops.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
L. señora Maria Blanca es uno D. los intregentes D. un grupo llamado Flor D. campo el cual esta conformado por doce personas las cuales son muy amables y trabajadoras cada una D. ellas tiene una actividad economica difrente Alejandro venD. sandalias, Galdina tiene una papeleria, Julissa venD. carne y tamales, Albera venD. reloj, Juana refrescos y dulces, Tomasa abarrotes, Juana B veneD. pan, Esteban tiene una panaderia, Aurora venD. ropa,Magdalena antojitos mexicanos y maria Guillermina zapatos.

L. señora Maria blanca tiene L. edad D. 54 años, estudio solo hasta L. secundaria y esta casada con el señor 
Juan que trabaja en el campo, ellos tienen tres hijas las cuales ya están casadas. Doña Maria Blanca nos platica que ha elL. siempre le ha gustado trabajar pero hace un poco mas D. cinco años con el apoyo D. su esposo abrio una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes para ganar un poco D. dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, elL. platica que gracias a Dios L. tienda va creciendo poco a poco y con el tiempo ha ido hacendo clienteL..

ElL. se encuentra muy contenta D. haber recibido este credito el cual piensa invertir en L. compra D. sopa, arroz, frijol, aceite, galletas, jabon y refrescos para resurtir su pequeño negocio.

elL. agradece a L. fundacion por el prestamo que se le ha otorgado y espera que con esta credito su negocio prospere y pueda dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y poco a poco ir agrandando su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria Blanca is one one of the members of a group called Flor D. Campo which is maD. up of 12 people who are very friendly and all of them work in a different field. Alejandro sells sandals. Galdina has a stationery store. Julissa sells meat and tamales. Albera sells clocks, Juana sells drinks and sweets. Tomasa has a grocery store. Juana B sells bread. Esteban has a bakery. Aurora sells clothing. Magdalena sells Mexican appetizers. Maria Guillermina sells shoes.

Maria Blanca is 54 years old, studied through secondary school, and is married to Juan who works in the fields, and they have three daughters who are already married.

Maria Blanca talks to us about how she has always liked her work but about five years ago with the help of her husband she opened a little grocery store in order to earn some extra money and to help her husband with the household expenses. She continues by saying that thanks to God the store is growing little by little and with time she has built up a client base.

She thanks the community bank for the loan that has been approved and she hopes that with this loan her business will prosper and she can give her family a better quality of life and bit by bit enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, drinks, sweets, soap and canned foods

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 39 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She is residing in Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. 

Myrna is engaged in the agricultural business sector. Her primary activity is planting and harvesting flowers for sale. She sells her flowers to her contract buyers in the market. She has been in this business for four years. She earns Php 2,600 every month. Myrna is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase manure for her flower farm.

In 2011, Myrna join GDMPC. Myrna's future plan is to expand her business. She plans to purchase a vehicle for the delivery of her flowers to the buyers.

loans.use: to purchase manure

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is a 29-year-old married woman who has one child. The couple works hard to earn a living. Roxanne was just selling balut before, but as time passed by, she decided to start her own business. Nowadays, she is operating her own balut-making business. Aside from her own business, she also has one in another place where she has a business partner. They started their joined business in January. Roxanne is thankful because her business continues to grow. She earns about P15,000 monthly in her own business. The income she generates from her business is used for their daily needs, other household expenses, and payment of electric bills.  

Roxanne acquires her fresh eggs in the villages of Cebu and Gud San Isidro. She makes her own balut at her house since she has the materials needed for making it. Roxanne would like to buy more fresh eggs due to the many buyers of balut but her funds are not sufficient, so she is asking for additional capital in the amount of P30,000. She hopes that through her patience and additional capital she could make her business expand and grow so that she could educate her only child and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fresh eggs for balut-making business

loans.name: 0306038-Quang Trung-Hoằng Thanh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyên works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry and cattle to expand her business.

Tuyên is 59 years old and married with three children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 38 Quang Trung-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group.
 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2005, Tuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyên has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tuyên has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Tuyên hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and cattle

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Raising crops is the primary source of income at Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. Noel and his family are engaged in this kind of work. He plants and harvests rice and future merchandise for the local traders in the village. Noel patiently ensures a good crop during planting season up to harvesting. He usually earns a yield twice a year (April and November) for about PHP 9,000. 

Noel is now 28 years old, married to Jennifer and has two children. He wants to improve his crop production for the education of his children so he needs fertilizers and herbicides to be used in rice farming. As of now, Noel has insufficient fund so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy these inputs.

In the future, Noel would like to improve his farming practices and increase his rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en: Erwina is a married woman with three children. Erwina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. Erwina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase products to resell. Erwina has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Erwina wants to build a house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 51 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with one child.

To earn a living, Antonia has a business selling herbal medicine. She earns about 10,000 pesos each month doing this type of work. Antonia has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase two boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

Antonia has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2011. In the future, Antonia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 44 years of age. She is married and blessed with three children. She lives in Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Judith owns & operates a retail store selling different kinds of products such as eggs, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, food for snacks and other family basic needs. 

She has been in this business for two years and she has a net return of PHP 3,200 every month. Judith is in need of funds. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase supplementary sari-sari/variety goods for her general store.

She joined GDMPC in October 2011. She plans that in the future she can buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods to sell

loans.name: 020906-Hoằng Đông Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

Huệ is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 06 Hoằng Đông solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2009, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 71 years old and lives in Upper Centro,Tudela,Misamis Occidental.  She is widowed with one child. 

Josefa has a shop that sells home products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional home products to sell.

Josefa has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Josefa hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and lives in Bolibol,Oroquieta City. She is married with 4 children. 
Gina has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP14,900 to purchase more products for her general store. 
Gina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a responsible and determined farmer. He is 44 years old, married, and has eight children. He is grateful because his wife is supportive in maintaining their corn field. Jaime devotes his time to his farming business because it's his family's main source of income. He has been managing his corn field for almost 25 years and he is able to earn about P20,000 per crop season. According to him, his income is not enough to cover their daily household expenses due to the large number of family member and high cost of commodities. 

Jaime is requesting a loan in the amount of P27,000 to buy farm supplies needed to make his corn field more productive. He is hoping that he could get the loan amount he requested to further increase his income during the next crop season so that he could educate all his children and improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to maintain his corn farming business

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico is 45 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is married with four children. 

Rico works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 35 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a fishing boat.
 
Rico has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and lives happily together with her husband. Her husband is a carpenter. They are blessed with four children. She lives in Cabilinan, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Jocelyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for five years and she has a net income per month of PHP 4,000

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. She joined GDMPC this October 2011.

Jocelyn hopes and prays that her business project will progress and be productive because she plans that if it has a good return, she will buy a mother pig.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is a married woman with seven children. Dina is 44 years old and resides at Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Dina is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products such as crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase raw materials for the business. Dina has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Dina wants to expand and improve her business and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the business

loans.name: Ainakan's Group

texts.en:
Ainakan is the leader of this group. She is 54 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a son and two daughters. Ainakan works in an Agency of Migration. Her monthly salary is 1,200 soms. In order to earn additional money, she breeds livestock and resells it after fattening. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, she purchased four goats for breeding. Reselling livestock after fattening and selling the dairy products, Ainakan earns an additional 4,500 soms to meet her daily needs. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she hopes to leave a good inheritance to her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the province of Isabela. He has been a farmer for 20 years. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests corn for sale. His business makes PHP 20,000 every harvest season. His wife has also managed their hog-raising business for five years. However, the most tiresome part is clearing the piggery and taking care of his hogs day after day. They both work hard to meet their family's daily needs and to give their children daily allowances.

Marcial is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is very happy with her fist loan from GDMPC; it helps her greatly. She was able to sell the pig she raised, and she paid her loan obligation. Genevieve returned to purchase another piglet to raise.  She is still engaged in this line of business of raising domestic animals - like pigs for sale. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She needs funds to purchase feed for her pigs' fast growth. She earns about PHP16,250 a month.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 again; the purpose of this request is to purchase food for the pigs' fast growth and good nourishment. Genevieve hopes that her business will prosper. She plans to buy more piglets to raise to make a good financial return.

loans.use: To purchase pig food for their fast growth.

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru: Иззатой трудолюбия женщина. Она замужем и у них 5 детей. Её муж пенсионер и ей необходимо работать на содержании семьи. С детство она научилась выращивать растение и овощи. Она работает на сельском хозяйстве с удовольствием более 7 лет. Иззатой выращивает овощи, а потом после сбора урожая продает за выгодную цену. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и ГСМ. А часть займа хочет использовать за оплаты труда работников. Она заранее благодарна вам за ваше внимание и доброты.
texts.en: Izzatoi is a hard-working woman. She is married and has five children. Her husband has retired, and it is essential for her to work in order to support the family. When she was a child, she learned to grow various plants including vegetables. She has enjoyed working in agriculture for more than seven yeras. Izzatoi grows vegetables, and after harvest, she is able to sell them for a good price. She would like to expand her business and make a good profit. She would like a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer and fuel. She will also use part of the loan to pay for manual labour. She is thankful in advance for your time and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel, and to pay for labour

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is married and has five adult children. He is now 60 years of age, but is still very active in farming. His wife is also a farmer.  He helps her in growing their farm.

Romulo owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. Romulo is engaged in planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this kind of activity for about 31 years. Romulo's primary income comes from this sort of rice production. Romulo earns about PHP 7,173 per month.

Romulo joined GDMPC in 2011. He applied for a loan in the cooperative in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase seedlings for the next cropping season. Romulo plans to purchase a rice hand tractor.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings

loans.name: Mahoni Kasih Group

texts.en:
Sri is 39 years old and married with two children, Yulianti and Daniel.  She is pictured in the photo above wearing the black shirt.  Yulianti is 13 years old and is in the 7th grade.  Daniel is 12 years old and is in 6th grade.  Her husband works as a driver.  

Sri has been selling dishes from her food stall for the last year.  The business runs smoothly and has been going quite well because there is not a lot of competition in her area.  The income helps ensure that the children's needs for school such as fees and uniforms can be met.

This is Sri's second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use this loan to increase the ingredients at her food stall by purchasing items such as pop ice, coffee, noodles, and rice.  This will help her have more variety in her stall to hopefully draw more customers.  She hopes that their family will continue to have enough money to pay for their children's education so that when they grow up they can have a better life.

The other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling vegetables, selling cakes, selling household appliances on credit, and selling slippers, umbrellas, and shoes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for more food such as pop ice, coffee, noodles, and rice to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a diligent father. He is 45 years old, married to Rebecca, and together they raise five children. Romulo has been involved in rice farming for almost 20 years and earns PHP 10,000 during harvest season. Harvest season usually falls during the month of April and November. Profits earned went to electric bills, meals, and daily allowances of his children. 

Romulo is in need of additional capital in buying moluscicides and pesticides (chemicals used to treat molusc and pest that destroy seedlings). He is asking for P15,000. 

In the future, Romulo wants to improve his crop production to earn enough income for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy moluscicides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима замужем и у неё четверо детей. Она занимается выращиванием и продажей сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как пшеницы, горох, арахис и кукурузы. Она сама является владельцем данного бизнеса и ей помогают муж и дети. Она хочет  расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она трудиться для того чтобы улучшить благосостояние семьи и содержать своих детей в хороших условиях. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и оплаты труда работников.
texts.en: Salima is married and has four children. She grows and sells various crops, such as wheat, peas, peanuts and corn. She owns her own business, and is assisted by her husband and children. She would like to expand her business and maximize profits. She works hard to improve the living conditions of her family and takes good care of her children. She would like a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay manual labourers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and to pay for labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Для покупки овощей и винограда

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 36 years of age, married, and has one school-aged child. He lives in Sumalig Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. His wife is a plain housekeeper, and taking care of his child.

Allan is in the agricultural business raising fish for sale. He operates and manages his fishpond. He is raising a milk-fish, locally known as "Bangus." He has been in this business activity for about six years. Allan had a net return of approximately PHP 7,230 a month.

Allan joined GDMPC this year. He applied a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase fish fingerlings to be raised in his fishpond. Allan hopes for his business to progress, and be able to have a high-quality return.

loans.use: to purchase fish fingerlings.

loans.name: Emiliza

texts.en: Emiliza is a married woman with four children. Emiliza is 33 years old, and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Emiliza owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to have addtional capital for crab fattening. Emiliza is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Emiliza wants to build house, and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to have addtional capital for crab fattening.

loans.name: Budi

texts.en:
Budi is a chips seller. With his last loan he was able to improve his business by produced various kinds of chips and also gaining a wider area to sell the chips.

Now he needs a bigger loan to expand his business. He wants to produce more chips. Many salesman come to his house to buy the chips and resell them to the small kiosks. The loan will be used to purchase tools and ingredients to make chips. He has a dream: to renovation his house with the profit that he earns.

loans.use: To purchase tools and ingredients to make chips.

loans.name: Aurea Marie

texts.en: Aurea Marie is 26 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Aurea Marie works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase fishing materials needed for fishing. Aurea Marie has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials needed for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers and herbs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and blessed with one school-age child. She is 52 years of age and lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte. Her husband is a farmer.

Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. She is operating a specialized general store selling basic commodities like sugar, eggs, noodles, bath soap, bar soap, coffee (sachet), foods for snacks, soft drinks and other products in her community. She has been in this business for ten years and able to have a revenue of about Php 6,000 a month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008. She has been member of GDMPC for three years. Marilyn is applying for a loan in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase additional basic commodities to sell. She plans to expand her business and save a portion of the return income for the education of her one and only child.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is married with 2 children. He is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years, and every month he earns about 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to finish the studies of his children and to have another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Karimzhon

texts.ru: Каримжон добросовестный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у него четверо детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он начинал свой бизнес 7 лет назад с арендования 50 соток земли и начал выращивать сельхозпродукты. В данный момент имеет дехканское хозяйство 12 гектар земли, где посеяно 2 гектар пшеницы, 70 соток лука, 20 соток чеснок и на 1 гектар имеет готовую продукцию моркови. Каримжон собирает урожай и на его место хочет посеять лук. Для переработки земли ему нужны минеральные удобрения и ГСМ.  С этой он запрашивает займ и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Karimzhon is an honest and goal-oriented man. He is married and has four children. He cultivates various crops. He started his business seven years ago, renting a 0.5 hectare plot of land and starting to grow crops. At the moment, he has a farm of 12 hectares, where he had sown 2 hectares of wheat, 0.7 hectares of onions and 0.2 hectares of garlic. He also has 1 hectare of carrots, ready to harvest. Karimzhon is harvesting his crops and would like to plant onions. To prepare the land, he needs mineral fertilizers and fuel. With this intention, he is asking for a loan and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase several bags of onions, potatoes and carrots

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, 24, is married to Edward, a pharmacist by profession. They have one child who is still too young for school. They all live together in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

Teresia has operated a beauty salon and a cosmetics shop for the past 14 months. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics, handbags, and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, handbags, and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kheam

texts.en: Kheam is 36 years old, married, and has 1 child. She works for others to make a living. She has been with this work for 1 year. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Kheam is applying for a loan to buy a rice paddy with her sibling and then sell it on the market. This loan will enable her to build her rice stock and sell it to the market to earn income to feed her family and child better.

loans.use: to buy a rice paddy for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is married with one school-age child. She lives in Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a truck operator. 

Priscilla manages her business in the manufacturing sector, making lampakanay. Lampakanay is made of plants from the fishpond, whose fibers are twisted or braided into rope. She sells her manufactured lampakanay used for decorations to her contract buyer to earn a living. This product is for export. She has been in this business for three years. She has a net income of approximately Php 6,500 every month.

Priscilla is a member of GDMPC this October 2011. She is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase additional raw materials. She plans to expand her business to accommodate the orders from her buyers.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (lampakanay)

loans.name: Pan

texts.en: Pan is a 49-year-old mother of 6 children. She is a farmer and also grows cassava to support her family. She has been in this business with her parents since she was around 10 years old. Pan is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She wants to plant cassava on her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to expand her cassava plantation and earn more income to better feed her family and build some savings for the future.

loans.use: to plant cassava on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ma. Petronila

texts.en:
Ma. Petronila is 49 years old and has five children. Three attend school and the rest have settled into marriage. To generate an income, she sews school uniforms, tablecloths and curtains. She had been doing it for 10 years and earns about P7,000 monthly. 

Ma. Petronila is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy thread, needles and fabrics to use in her sewing service. She wants to improve her services to acquire more customers and earn more profits, too.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and fabrics to use in her sewing service.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 34, is married with five children, three girls and two boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and food for the family.

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation, especially during rainy season. She dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner is married with 1 child. He is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.

He is operating a rental-based business, providing boarding house rental services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earns approximately 11,300 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair existing rental houses for better service.

Abner has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Abner hopes to expand his boarding house rental business and to gain double income out of his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for building rental houses.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Файзулло примерный семьянин отец пятерых детей Он вместе с женой занимается агробизнесом. У него большой опыт в этой сфере уже на протяжении 25 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур лука, зерна, моркови. Он от дохода старается содержать свою семью и создать все условия для них. Он хочет получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. Он надеется получить займ и обработать землю для подготовки к новому посеву.
texts.en: Faizullo is an exemplary family man and a father of five children.  Together with his wife, he is involved in an agricultural business.  He has an extensive experience in this field since he has been growing agricultural crops, such as onions, cereals, carrots, for 25 years.  Faizullo tries to use the business income to support his family and provide all of the necessary conditions for them.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and pesticides.  He hopes to get this loan and treat his land to prepare for the new sowing season.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem passed the 8th standard, but couldn’t complete her education due to her parents' poor financial conditions. She got married in her young age, and now she has 3 sons and 2 daughters. 3 of them are studying while the other 2 are below 4 years of age. Shameem is a great mother and takes care of her family very well. 

Her husband has a spare parts selling business. His shop is located in the market and he offers quality services and products to his clients. Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy different brands and types of spare parts to be able to fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his income. He has been doing his business for the past many years and Shameem is very hopeful that after the loan investment his business will grow and increase his income. 

Shameem is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client in her first loan year. She paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem”.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 35 years old and married with 1 child. She buys soybeans and sells them to the market to make a living. To support her family, she also plants cassava on her farmland. She has been with this business for almost 10 years. 

Chantha has been with VisionFund since 2009. She completely paid her loans to VisionFund. And now she is applying for a third loan. Chantha wants to buy soybeans for her business and sell to the market. This loan will help her to increase her stock and earn more income for her family and build some savings to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soybeans for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine, a 29-year-old single mother of one child, lives in Talic, Oroquieta City where she has a balut-vending business that earns her approximately PHP 5,000 each month.  A member of PMPC for a year, she has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients to make balut. Geraldine, a good daughter and an honest person, hopes to earn a substantial income in the future to help her parents

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her balut-making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a microscope.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is willing to give his time to work hard every single day to provide his family with a good quality of life. He has dedicated himself to his corn farm business for eight years, and earns about P35,000 every crop season. The wife of this 34-year-old father of two school-aged children has a hog-raising business, buying pigs and then selling them after she has fattened them. They both hard work to provide for their needs and to be able to send their children in school.

Freddie is requesting a loan of P30,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizers for his corn production. He hopes to grow his business and harvest more corn to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizers for his corn production.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is married. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and every month she earn 8,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Medelyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Medelyn hopes to have her children finish their studies and to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru: Гулгунсо разведена, и у неё 4 детей. Она любит своих детей и старается обеспечить во всем. Боле 6 лет она занимается пошивом национальной одежды дома. Её клиенты приходят к ней домой, и заказывают платья, а также вышивку тамбурным швом. Она также учит своих дочерей этому ремеслу. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и желает закупить другую швейную машинку. С этой целью она запрашивает займ и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Gulguncha is divorced and has four children. She loves her kids and tries her best to take care of them. For more then six years she has been sewing Tajik national dresses. Her clients visit her at her home and purchase both sewing services as well as chain stitch embroidery that decorate these dresses. Gulguncha has also taught sewing and embroidery to her daughters. She would like to expand her business and wants to purchase a second sewing machine. With this goal Gulguncha is requesting the loan from Kiva and would like to thank you for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah used his previous loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TY kits.  His business improved since he serviced the loan.  He has also improved the business with the business management skills that he has gained from the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.

Now, he has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy his own house.

loans.use: To buy a house.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 47 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She intends to buy a fishing net and her husband will manage said business. She earns,PHP  9,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  of 5,000 PHP only  to purchase a new fishing net to use in catching fish.

Nena has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Nena hopes to acquire a big fishing boat for her husband to use in fishing.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing net to use in catching fish.

loans.name: Salimbek

texts.ru: Салимбек ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Ради своей жены и детей он начал заниматься торговлей, чтобы создать им лучшие домашние условия и сделать их счастливыми. Более 8 лет Салимбек занимается купле- продажей запчастей на местном рынке. Он старается привозить качественные запчасти, чтобы привлечь много клиентов. Таким образом, он хочет приобрести широкий ассортимент запчастей для разных видов автомашин и расширить свой бизнес. Для этой покупки он хотел бы получить займ, и надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Salimbek is a dependable and goal oriented man. For the sake o creating better living conditions for his wife and children he has started his own business. For more then eight years Salimbek has been selling spare auto parts at the local market. He tries to only sell quality parts to attract more clients. Currently he wants to expand his inventory and purchase a large assortment of different parts for various car models and expand his business. To finance the purchase he is taking out this loan and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Marietta owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been in this business for five years. 

Each month she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials. 

Marietta has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Marietta wants to build a house and enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Sajida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Sajida Perveen is 41 years old, a housewife, and spends her time at home managing her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a used clothing business. He purchases used clothes from the clothes market and sells the items to his customers at a profit.

Sajida is the mother of three daughters and three sons. She knows very well the importance of education, and all of her children are literate. Her eldest daughter has completed her BSC degree and joined the nursing profession, while her elder son works with his father in his business. He has also completed his education through the 10th standard. Her remaining four children are currently in school.

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help further the expansion of her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase used clothes in bulk. Doing so will allow him to offer more variety to his customers, thereby increasing his sales and profits. 

Sajida's husband is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Sajida is hopeful that the loan investment will improve it further.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Sokon

texts.en:
Sokon is 41 years old, married and has five children. For the last ten years, she has been planting cassava to make a living. She also plants rubber on her farmland to generate additional income. 

Sokon has been with VisionFund since 2010. She completely repaid her first loan to VisionFund. Sokon is requesting her second loan. She wants to plant rubber and also renovate her house. 

This loan will enable her to plant more rubber, have a better house for her family, and also earn more income.

loans.use: to plant more rubber on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and lives in Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. She is widowed and has three children. 

Myrna has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 600 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 29 years old and married.  He sells clothes to earn a living.  

He has been in this business for three years and employs one person.  He is also employed in a supermarket.  Benson runs his business in a busy environment where he gets regular clientele.

He wants to grow his business so he can earn more income. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 33 years old and supports her husband by operating a rope-selling business. The ropes she sells are used for making cots. She started this business a few years ago to meet the financial expenses of her family. 

Her husband is a master tailor. He operates his shop in the market and provides quality sewing services to his clients. 

Kalsoom is the mother of two daughters and three sons. Three of her children study, while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business of selling ropes. With the loan, she will buy ropes in larger quantities. That will allow her to finish clients’ orders on time and increase her profits. 

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating the business for the past ten years. She is confident that an investment will help her expand her business. 

Kalsoom is a regular loan user of Asasah. This is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she has proven herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: to buy ropes for selling.

loans.name: Mavlonbi

texts.ru: Мавлонби занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания на местном центральном рынке. Она замужем и у неё одна девочка ей три года. Её муж работает в цехе по производству  сахара. Она помогает мужу в содержании  семьи и хочет обеспечить свою любимую девочку  всем. Её бизнес успешен и получает хорошую прибыль. Так как она продает свой товар по оптовым низким ценам привлекает много постоянных клиентов и она с радостью обслуживает их. Мавлонби хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов для разнообразия товаров и привлечения новых клиентов.
texts.en: Mavlonbi sells groceries at the local market. She is married and has a three year old daughter. Her husband works at the sugar factory and Mavlonbi assists him in supporting their young family because she wants to make sure her beloved daughter has everything she needs. Her grocery business is doing well and is very profitable. Since Mavlonbi tries to keep her prices close to the low wholesale prices she is able to attract many steady clients and she is happy to serve them. Mavlonbi would like to take a loan to purchase additional goods for the grocery business in order to expand her inventory and be able to attract new clients.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
