Also he can not always make preservation of the raw material in due to have much orders. Thereforen Ariuntuya will be responded for the raw material supplying of their joint business in the further. This year she has a plan to reserve the wood with preservation of the next years. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the wood by a large amount for preservation of working capital.

loans.use: To purchase the wood by a large amount for preservation of working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cows and fodder for them to eat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is a 51year-old farmer from the village of Velistsikhe, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Leila. 

Ivane is an electrician and has a small car repair workshop in the village. He has rented the space for the workshop. Ivane repairs the electric parts of cars. Along with his main job, Ivane is busy with agriculture. The family owns a vineyard, where local species of vines are grown. Ivane sells most of the harvested grapes. A small part is used for wine production. Produced wine is sold locally as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Ivane requested the loan for purchasing agricultural land, which is located in the village, near to his house. Ivane and Leila will cultivate the land and sow various vegetables. Ivane will sell harvested vegetables locally to greengrocery retailers. A new business initiative will increase the income of the family. Ivane plans to reinvest a big part of the profit in the family agricultural business.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 26 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook), is a homemaker. She is very active and has many household duties. She and her husband have a six-year-old son who is enrolled in the first grade.

Her husband sells wheat at the local market. He is very fair with his clients in his dealings and sells high-quality wheat. Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan funds, he will buy wheat in larger quantities, which will allow him to provide better-quality wheat in larger quantities, thus allowing him to earn more profits.

Rukhsana is confident that her husband will become more successful in his business after the loan investment. He has been operating his business for many years and Rukhsana has full confidence in him.

She is a new loan applicant through Asasah.

loans.use: to buy wheat to offer for sale

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, age 33, is involved in two businesses: one is sewing and the other is animal breeding. She purchases animals such as goats and sheep in their early age and raises them to sell for profit. Razia's husband is a mason by profession and constructs buildings and housing on contract.

Razia is very efficient and performs her household duties very well along with maintaining her businesses. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are schooling and three of whom are at home.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy goats and sheep, raise them, and sell them to local butchers.
  
Razia has been operating her animal sales business for the past five years and is very confident that the loan investment will allow her to be successfully able to improve its earnings.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated a juice sales business for the past three years, selling to her neighbors and to passers-by. Her major challenge is competition from other juice sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

Jane and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase fruits to use for making juice to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to use for making juice to offer for sale

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont deux vont aux collège et un au lycée.En 2000 ayant  considéré les charges de sa famille,elle commence a vendre des poulets a bouillir en détail  au marche sur un étalage, après quelques années, avec ses benefices, elle ouvre une boucherie , poissonnerie et une alimentation et en 2010, elle reçoit le premier prêt de Hope, et avec ses differents prêts son commerce change réellement,ses ventes ont augmentes,son capital a largement évolué et elle rembourse sans difficultés et fait des épargnes considérables.

A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises,en ajoutant des cartons de poules a bouillir , des cartons de cuisses de poulets, des cartons de saucissons, des cartons de viande comme les queues de bœuf, l'arrière et l'avant ,quelques cartons de poisson soles,  des boites de tomates pelées, des cartons de macédoines.
Elle a l'intention d'ouvrir une chambre froide, comme une bonne mère de famille, elle s'occupe valablement de sa famille et travaille maintenant  en association  avec son mari.
texts.en:
This customer is 39 years old, married and mother to three children, two of whom are at secondary school and one at "lycée". In 2000 she began to sell chickens for boiling on a stall in the market in order to cover her expenses, and after several years she used her profits to open a shop selling meat, fish and groceries. In 2010 she got her first loan from Hope and with the various loans she has received her business has undergone a real change, her sales have increased, her capital developed significantly and she manages without any difficulty to repay her loans and save a considerable amount.

On receipt of her new loan she is going to boost her stock with cartons of chickens for boiling, chicken thighs, sausage and meat, such as oxtail, hindquarters and forequarters, as well as several cartons of sole, canned tomatoes and cartons of mixed diced vegetables.

She intends to open a cold storage room and as a good mother she looks after her family well and now works together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken thighs, hindside, pork, sausages and fish.

loans.name: Vukuzenzele Group

texts.en:

Davidzo also operates a flea market stand at Garikai flea market. She has been in this business for three years and has one employee. 

Davidzo is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy hair pieces and clothes. She sees herself owning a shop to operate from in the next five years. The business faces a challenge of high competition in the market. She looks forward to buying more household assets from her profits.

loans.use: to purchase hair pieces and clothes

loans.name: Caroline

She is married with two children ages 9 and 10. She employs one farmhand. She also has a retail tea business. She sources her tea from other farmers in the area.

Caroline has made a 20,000 KES loan request from Juhuhdi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for her poultry-farming business. She says the loan will enable her business to double and to make life better for her family as well as provide income to educate her two children.

Caroline is happy Juhudi Kilimo is providing farmers with loans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds for her poultry-farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a local brew for resell.

With the 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roselyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel (pictured above on a motorcycle) is aged 43 and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. He has been in farming for 13 years and employs one farmhand, producing milk and tea and selling both to the local market. He also runs a motocycle transport business, which provides additional income.

Joel has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He says the loan will help him improve his income and his family living standards. He is optimistic the poultry business will continue to grow and even boost his transport which he runs alongside farming and provide income to educate the three children still schooling.

He mentions poor weather conditions and inflation on farming as the major challenges to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a single mother of three children; two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and meat for roasting. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and meat for roasting.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house for her children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with six children; four attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major high cost of transportation and seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES),  she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Luteka Group

texts.en:
Everlyne joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Everlyne will invest in a cow and build a house.

Everlyne is the facilitator of Luteka group. Everlyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Luteka group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with eight children; six attend school while two have graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells poultry meat to restaurant operators. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation and seasonality in the business. 

With this loan of 75,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and chicks for her poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants another loan facility to buy radios, hair extensions, and watches for resale in his retail shop. He feels this will enable him to accumulate capital to start up his dream wholesale shop. His goal is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy radios, hair extensions, and watches for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old and has been in farming for over five years, with his current produce being eggs for the local market. He is single and lives in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, which is his paternal home. He also retails tea, which he sources from other farmers in the area.

Paul has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and expand his poultry farming business. He says the business will help him build a strong foundation for a family and will meet his basic needs. He is optimistic his business will continue to grow.

He says finances for doing business remain a farmer’s challenge.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward wants a loan to buy maize and beans produce for resell. 

Aged 48 years, he hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda. Edward is the father of eight children, whom he lives with together with their mother in a semi-permanent house. 

Having started in farming, he saved money to start up that business, which has grown over twenty years. 

His dream is to educate his children and he wishes to acquire a motorcycle to help with transportation.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for sell.

loans.name: Lukongo A Group

texts.en:
Alphayo takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alphayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alphayo was only able to harvest 1/2 a bag of maize on ½  acres of land.
With income from maize sales, Alphayo will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Alphayo is the facilitator of Lukongo A group. Alphayo and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Lukongo A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alphayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children; four attend school while three are too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a posho mill machine, grinding maize for flour. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing a posho mill machine.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase spare parts, fuel, and pay for a license. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, fuel, and pay for a license.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yogurt and apples to sell in his store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old, a married woman, and has one child who is not in school. She has a business selling medicines in a clinic in Yei, South Sudan, for the past five years.

Grace requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase medicines. With her extra income from this loan, she hopes to open up a big pharmacy in the future.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for sale

loans.name: Purna Maya

texts.en:
Purna Maya is 35 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged 15, 11 and 4. In 1998, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Purna Maya plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Having been in the cattle business for such a long time, Richard decided to diversify his income by venturing into timber trading. He has been in this new business for two years and the business is promising. Richard needs the loan facility to purchase timber for resale.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
In a bid to expand his farm, Peter got a loan to buy a heifer for rearing. A commercial farmer, Peter wants to construct a residential house for his family and dreams of owning his own cattle farm.

Peter intends to use the loan to buy another heifer for rearing.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for rearing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 17 and 16. In 1995, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, aged 32 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the bricklaying business for 6 years and in a bid to increase his income sources, he has also ventured into the transport business. He wants this loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business, which is commonly known as bodaboda by locals.

He dreams of educating his four children and buying a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Golden Girls Group

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Silibaziso from Harare. She is single and has one child who attends school. Silibaziso runs an agriculture business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for one year. She says the main challenge she faces is insufficient capital to run her business. Silibaziso has requested a loan of $300 to buy chicks and stock feeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Silibaziso plans to open a takeaway business.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has a business of selling breads in Yei, South Sudan, for the last four years.

Regina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale

loans.name: Shinning Star Group

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Jane from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, who all attend school. Jane runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for the past four years. She says the main challenge she faces is having capital for restocking. Jane has requested a loan of $400 for grocery stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her stock levels, thereby maximizing on profit. In the future, Jane plans to have a wholesale grocery business.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock

loans.name: Max

texts.en:
Max is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar and restaurant business for three years. She began with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. 

Her main hardship is limited financial resources, and her wish is a good strategic location for the restaurant, a stock of 10,000,000 shillings, plus a house. Max needs the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Wesly

texts.en:
Wesly is a resident and farmer in Litein South Rift, Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for four years, producing poultry and tea for the local market. He also trades tea at the local market with his tea being sourced from his farm and from other farmers locally. He is married with one child, aged 8 years. Wesly is 26 years of age.

Wesly has made a loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for his poultry farming business. He is optimistic that his business will improve in the near future and enable him provide better living standards for his family.

He is greatful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support to farmers both with the loans and the training provided.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She has a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for the last four years.

Jennifer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 50-year-old mixed crop farmer, is married to Mary, a business lady, and they are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years. He has been in the business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

After being introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member, Joseph is applying for his third loan which he will use to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig-rearing to further improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Los Lagos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Lagos” lo conforman 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran locales establecidos con la venta de abarrotes, frutas secas, repostería, venta de joyas, perfumes, disfraces, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Luz integrante del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, en el lugar de en medio, vistiendo una chaqueta negra con cuello de chiporro blanco y quien además usa su cabello suelto. Ella se dedica a la vitrofusión (arte con vidrio fundido a gran temperatura) y también se dedica a comprar disfraces para arrendarlos. Se dedica a estos dos negocios desde hace 4 años. Vende y arrienda desde su casa y promociona sus productos y disfraces por internet.  
La materia prima la compra en vidrieras y los disfraces en tiendas comerciales y tiendas de remate. 
Comenta que las temporadas más altas de venta son a principio y final de año, el resto del año vende de manera esporádica.
Con el crédito comprará materiales para su negocio de vitrofusión, entre  vidrios catedrales de distintos colores, espejos, marcos, pegamento y para el negocio de disfraces comprará telas.
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido para ofrecer sus productos de artesanía y disfraces.
Luz vive junto a sus dos hijas de 25 y 9 años de edad, su hija mayor trabaja y estudia la carrera de educación diferencial y en sus ratos libres le ayuda a cortar vidrios. Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener mejores ingresos con sus negocios para postular al subsidio habitacional y concretar el sueño de su casa propia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que están muy afiatados y se ha generado una relación de compromiso. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Los Lagos' and it has 19 entrepreneurial members who all work in different fields.  Their businesses include established  premises where they sell groceries, dried fruit, confectionery, jewelry, perfumes, costumes, etc.  All the members live in the city of Puerto Montt. 

Luz is a member of this community bank.  In the photo she is standing in the first row, in the middle, wearing a black jacket with a white sheepskin collar.  She is wearing her hair loose.  Her business is glassblowing (art with glass which is melted at high temperatures) and she also buys fancy dress costumes to hire out.  She has been working in these businesses for four years.  She sells and hires her products from her home and promotes her products and costumes on the Internet.  She buys her raw materials from glassworks and her costumes from commercial stores and auction stores.  She comments that her peak sales seasons are at the beginning and end of the year.  The rest of the year she sells sporadically.  

Luz will use her loan to buy materials for her glassblowing business: different colored cathedral glasses, mirrors, frames and adhesive, and she will also buy fabric for her costume business.  Her goal for her business is to have an established sales premises where she can offer her handicrafts and costumes.  

Luz lives together with her two daughters who are 25 and 9 years old.  Her eldest daughter works and is studying for a degree in special needs education and, in her free time, she helps her mother cut glass.  Luz's dreams on a personal level are to make better income from her businesses to apply for housing subsidy and complete her dream of owning her own home.  She is very happy about and grateful for the services delivered by Fondo Esperanza.  As regards the community bank that she is a member of, she comments that they are very well-organized and have developed a committed relationship.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile which is located in Los Lagos region.  Some of the attractions of Puerto Montt are its beautiful green landscapes, its quiet beaches, its cuisine (especially the reputation of its seafood and fish) and its handicrafts.  It is also the gateway to Isla Grande de Chiloé which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy materials for her glassblowing business (cathedral glasses in different colors, mirrors, frames, adhesive and fabric for her fancy dress costume business

loans.name: Slyver

texts.en: Slyver sells second hand clothes in Masindi, Uganda. He is 54-years old and is married with two children. He lives in his own house with his family. He used to be in livestock farming, but he sold the animals to get initial capital for his business. He dreams of educating his children, increasing his stock, and the money he makes from four to eight million UGX. Slyver is requesting a loan to buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with one young child. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation. 

For the past six years, she has been a farmer, keeping cattle for milk sales and bulls for tilling the land. She sells milk at the market and to her neighbors and passersby. Chinyavu's work is very challenging during the dry hot season and the amount of milk produced then is lower. She dreams of establishing a borehole to store water for her cattle during dry season.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, to purchase a bull for plowing the land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bull to plow the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the transport business for one year. He was formerly working as a mechanic. His hardships are high fuel, high transport costs and increased capital. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goal is expanding his business to new markets. Frank needs the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Litein in South Rift Kenya. He is aged 26 and has been in farming for 4 years producing tea and eggs for the local market. He also runs a tea retail business at the local market. He is married with one child aged 2 years.

John has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and boost his poultry farming business. He says the income generated will help him improve his family living standards by providing for their basic needs. He plans to improve his business and become a major supplier for the local market.

He sees no challenges, save for lack of capital among smallholder farmers (usually farms supporting a single family).

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a thirty-five-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the supermarket business for six years. He acquired capital from savings he earned as a teacher. His hardships are high fuel and transport costs and few customers. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets. Obed needs the loan facility to buy soda and eggs for sale

loans.use: To buy soda and eggs for sale

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evans is a 29-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jemimah who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 10.000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his 1st loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Evans will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy another piece of land. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to the university level and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Kasika Business Group

texts.en: Pauliano is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for six years. He started the business after saving money from distilling local brew. His hardship is inadequate capital, and his vision is to have a stock of six million plus educating his children. Pauliano needs this loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Kusiima Women Group

texts.en:
Noeline is a hardworking lady and the leader of Kusiima Women Group found in Karuguuza, Uganda. She is married with two children and she has one other dependent at the moment. She lives in a rented house in a family of five people. 

Noeline has been in the fish sales business for three years. She started as a vender but now she has a big stock and her business is booming. However, she faces the challenge of bad debtors and hopes, in future, her business will grow big. Noeline needs a loan to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a married man with two children who are still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has piped water and he pays electricity bills. For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in the area. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetables and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 23-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling goats and chickens in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase goats and chicken. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy cows to add to her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and goats for sale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 57-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jane who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stanley will use the loan to buy seedlings and farm manure for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into fish farming. His hopes and dreams are to export the farm produce which will help him educate his children up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and farm manure for his farm.

loans.name: Shalom Of Sewa 2 Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Revonia from Harare. She is single with one child. Revonia runs a manufacturing business producing peanut butter and detergents. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the major challenges she faces are lack of funds, the high costs of transport to carry stock, and price fluctuations. 

Revonia has requested a loan of $150 to purchase groundnuts and raw materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve production levels and increase income for the family. In the future, Revonia plans to open a big peanut butter-making company.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and raw materials

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is 63 years old. A mixed crop farmer, she is married to John. They are blessed with one child, age 32. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings which she uses to support her family.

Theresia is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Theresia will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into coffee farming. Her hopes and dreams are to export farm produce which will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is married with five children; four attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local gin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for selling

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, married with 7 children aged 12-24, living in his own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 
For 6 years, he has been dealing in produce, buying and selling. He started with a capital of 700,000 UGX and now has a capital of 4,500,000 UGX. He faces a challenge of frequent price fluctuations in the market and his dream is to own a big store. John needs a loan to buy maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and millet to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt and sugar for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap and salt for resale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old and has been farming actively for more than 15 years in his home area of Litein, which is the South Rift region of Kenya. He is married with 4 children, all of whom are in school. His farm produces milk, pineapples, and tea, which he sells to the local market. He also has low-cost rental houses that provide him with additional income. He currently employs two farmhands.

Julius has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says the additional cow will help him raise his income, part of which he plans to use to construct a modern dairy unit for his cows. This is his second loan with Juhudi, following his first of 30,000 KES.

Julius laments of lack of dairy feed, especially during dry seasons. He remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support it gives farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es: María Milagros tiene 50 años, su actividad es la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Ella sueña con agrandar su negocio ya que ha sido beneficioso para mantener a su familia. Tiene 1 hijo de 13 años bajo su cargo, ella sale algunas veces a vender sus productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de  kerosene, formol, colorante, gasolina y cera.
texts.en: María Milagros is 50 years old and she makes and sells cleaning products. This is not her first loan. Her dream is to enlarge the business as it has been helpful in the support of her family. She has one child, 13 year old, in her care. Sometimes she leaves her store to sell her products. She is asking for a loan in order to buy kerosene, formaldehyde, dyes, gasoline and wax.

loans.use: to buy kerosene, formaldehyde, dyes, gasoline and wax

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 30-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her family's goals are to provide a better education for the children and to improve the family's living conditions, such as by constructing a good house.

Monica owns a retail shop dealing in beer, sodas, and sugar. She is faced with the problem of insufficient capital to expand her business. The purpose of the loan she has requested is to buy more beer, sodas, and sugar for resale.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Davies

texts.en:
Davies is 20 years old and has been in poultry farming for 3 years. His poultry birds, milk, and eggs go to the local market. He is single and lives in his home area of Litein, in the South Rift region of Kenya, where he does his farming.

Davies has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more poultry birds for his farming business. He says the loan will help him boost his business and build a strong foundation for his family in the future. He says he will save his income and make his farming more commercial. He hopes to be the main supplier for broilers and layers for the local market. He laments the large fluctuations in milk prices.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est formé de deux personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante  de ce groupe, nommée Akoko Séfako, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akoko Séfako est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Lucien. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Akoko Séfako vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Il y a environs huit ans que Akoko Séfako exerce comme activité, la vente des produits de coiffure et des mèches, ce qui lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la maison. Dans le souci d'élargir davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Akoko Séfako désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Akoko Séfako sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group Jesukpego is composed of two people living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Akoko Séfako, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity.

Akoko Séfako is 38 years old and is married to a mechanic named Lucien. The couple has five children, some attend school and all are under their financial responsibility. She lives with her husband and children. The couple provides together for all the household expenses.

For about eight years Akoko Séfako’s business has been selling hair products and hair extensions. This allows her to contribute without much difficulty to the needs of the household. In order to further expand her business and to better meet the needs of her customers, she wishes to increase her stock of products. To do this, Akoko Séfako requests together with the other group members of Jesukpego (Missessin), a third loan from ALIDé.The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: purchase hair products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de refrescos y ropa usada. Uno de los desafíos que María atraviesa es el tiempo ya que tiene que atender a sus dos hijos menores de edad y atender su negocio. Inicio con capital propio pues necesitaba obtener un medio de ingreso para su hogar. El motivo del crédito es variado pues comprara de un poco de todo como pajillas, bolsas, azúcar, frutas, pantalones, camisas, faldas entre otros.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora works selling drinks and used clothing. One of the challenges she faces is that at the same time has to care for her two young children and attend her store. She began with her own funds as she needed a way to pay her household expenses. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a little of everything such as drinking straws, bags, sugar, fruit, pants, shirts, skirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy drinking straws, bags, sugar, fruit, pants, shirts, skirts and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 30-year-old woman, married with 3 children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her family's objectives are to educate the children and improve the family's standard of living.

Jane deals in the purchase and sale of charcoal. She has limited capital to meet the increasing demand of her customers and she would like to get a loan to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Chiboga

texts.en: Chiboga is taking another Kiva loan of KSHS 40,000 to add stock to her fish selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Chiboga dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 30-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her dream is to have her children educated and awarded degrees. She has the challenge of inadequate capital to invest into her business. She has a boutique business where she buys and sells old clothes to customers. She needs more capital to buy second-hand clothes to sell. She is the lady in the blue skirt.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 32-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children to the university level and construct a good house for the family. She has the challenge of limited capital to invest in her business. She intends to use the loan facility to buy sodas, beers and fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer and fresh foods

loans.name: Alleluia Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALLELUIA est formé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Akouavi Blandine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akouavi Blandine est âgée de 29 ans et mariée à un revendeur du nom de Raffic. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Blandine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Akouavi Blandine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis six ans, Akouavi Blandine exerce comme activité, la vente de tissus ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Akouavi Blandine désire renforcer le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Akouavi Blandine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALLELUIA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Alleluia group is composed of two persons who are friends.The representative of the group, named Akouavi Blandine, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. It is the second time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to raise the level of their activity.

Akouavi Blandine is 29 years old and married to a reseller named Raffic. The couple has four children all in school and all are their dependents. Blandine Akouavi lives with her husband and children. The couple provides together for all the different expenses of the household. Akouavi Blandine has not attended school.

For six years Akouavi Blandine’s activity has been the sale of fabric. This allows her to contribute without much difficulty to the needs of the family. In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Blandine Akouavi wants to strengthen the level of her activity. To do this, Blandine Akouavi requests, together with the other members of the Alleluia group, a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: purchase fabric.

loans.name: Maro-Ya Group

texts.fr: MARO-YA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Islamia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Islamia est mariée à un électricien bâtiment du nom de Moustapha. Le couple a trois enfants, dont deux à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Islamia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Islamia n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Islamia vend depuis vingt cinq ans, des produits divers dans un marché du Bénin. Islamia s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Islamia sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARO-YA . Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Maro-Ya is a group consisting of three women, who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Islamia (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old.

Islamia is married to an construction electrician named Mustafa. The couple has three children, of whom two are dependents. Some of the children attend school. Islamia lives together with her ​​husband and children. The couple shares responsibility for dealing with various household expenses.

Islamia has not attended school. To deal with her varied responsibilities over the past 25 years, Islamia has been selling a variety of products in one of Benin's markets. She gets her supplies from Nigeria. 

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her working capital and strengthen her business, Islamia, together with other members of the Maro-Ya  group, is requesting her first credit loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to better meet the demands of their customers and make more profits.

loans.use: Buy various products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food supplies and pay for school fees

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: Cristina, Maria De La Cruz, Georgina, Marina, Janette Del Socorro, Pabla Teresa, Danelia Francisca, Alma Rosa, Maria Eulogia y Lilliam conforman el banco comunal Las Mariposas. Cristina se dedica a  una pulpería, refrescos y ornados desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio, todas son mujeres muy emprendedoras y trabajadoras por lo que se sienten muy orgullosas de tener negocios en los cuales ellas puedan ser sus propias jefas. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Cristina, Maria De La Cruz, Georgina, Marina, Janette Del Socorro, Pabla Teresa, Danelia Francisca, Alma Rosa, Maria Eulogia y Lilliam  make up the communal bank called Las Mariposas. Cristina has had a grocery store, selling soft drinks and ornaments for more than 12 years. They are all enterprising and hardworking women who are proud of having businesses where they can be their own bosses. The reason for the loan is to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, dry grains, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, dry grains, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his locksmith business

loans.name: Turikumwe / Nymt Group

texts.fr:
Innocent fait partie du groupe Turikumwe / Nymt. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 2 mois à 15 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Il a aussi deux autres personnes en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Innocent est le propriétaire d’une alimentation et bar.  C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter du riz, des haricots, du savon et des boisson non alcoolisées.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de bien accueillir la clientèle. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et construire une maison moderne pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Innocent belongs to the Turikumwe/Nymt group. He is married with five children, ranging from two months of age to 15 years old; four of the children are at school. He also has two other people in his care. He has six years of primary education.

Innocent is the owner of a grocery store and bar. This is his third loan from ACB. He is going to use it to buy rice, beans, soap and soft drinks. 

He plans to grow his business through the welcome he reserves for his customers. With the profits he makes he intends to educate his children and build a modern house for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soap and soft drinks

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: Sandra Veronica.D. 21 años D. edad y tiene un hijo,ella se dedica a la confeccion y venta D. tejidos tipicos desD. hace varios años,ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque aparte D. ser una actividad muy rentable le gusta su trabajo,ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicosm, ya que por esta epoca es cuando se venD. mas,y es cuando pueD. aumentar mas su capital,el sueño D. ella es darle lo mejor a su hijo y que en un futuro sea un profecional.
texts.en: Sandra Veronica is 21 years old and has a child. She has been weaving and selling traditional fabrics for several years. She tells us that she is happy because apart from being a very profitable activity she likes her work. She is asking us for this loan to buy the raw materials to weave traditional fabrics since at this time of the year she sells the most material and it is when she can raise more capital. Her dream is to give her child the best and that in the future s/he become a professional.

loans.use: to weave and sell fabrics.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pastes. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este medio de vida, ella ha sido una persona muy atenta que se encuentra muy pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de telas, hilos, esponjas entre otros productos necesarios para su elaboración. Ella sale todos los días temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que llega a su casa de vender sus productos.
texts.en: Luz Marina makes and sells bath scrubbers, sponges, and brushes. She has been doing this for more than six years. She has been aware of her clients needs and what they are asking for. The reason for this loan is to buy fabrics, thread, sponges and other products that she needs to make her pastes. She leaves early at 7:00 AM and gets home at 9:00 PM in order to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and sponges

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Ruben trabaja  como chofer  asociado un sindicato de trufis de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es costurera. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales como ladrillo, cemento, arena, para  la construcción de dos habitaciones en la planta alta de su domicilio. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Ruben obtiene un crédito en nuestra institución con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y por esta razón se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Rubén works as a driver associated with a cooperative minibus syndicate in the city of La Paz and his wife’s a seamstress.  He needs the loan to build two rooms on the top story of his house.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone; he’s married and has two children.  This is the first time Rubén has gotten a loan from our institution with the goal of improving his family’s quality of life and this is why it’s being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay cost of adding two rooms to his house.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
Rosa, por la necesidad de aumentar el negocio, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, para invertirlo en ropa, comprara camisas, blusas, ropa de niños e interior, la inversión anterior le dio un equilibrio en la mercadería, para ofrecer a los clientes, se mantuvo con las ventas, y con los clientes.
Ella considera que ha mejorado su capacidad y espera tener mejores resultados de la presente inversión.
texts.en: Rosa needs to grow her business which is why she asking for another loan. She will invest this in buying clothes; she will buy shirts, blouses, children's clothing and underwear. The previous loan gave her a balanced merchandise to offer her customers and she maintained both sales and customers. She believes this has improved her capacity and she expects to have better results with this current investment.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, children's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a collator and a folding machine for her printer.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Actualmente, Ángela solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, porque su padre y hermanos están iniciando el proceso de siembra, comprara abono y herbicidas, el préstamo le ayudara sobre todo a su padre para que cuente con lo necesario para el cultivo.
La aspiración de Ella es, apoyar a su familia mientras permanezca soltera, que sus padres sientan su ayuda, además desea que el negocio con la granja de cerdos cada día sea más prospero.
texts.en:
Currently Angela is asking for a loan in order to buy agriculture supplies because her father and brothers are beginning the process of planting. 

She will buy fertilizer and herbicides. The loan will especially help her father because he will have have what he needs to grow the crops. 

Her dream is to help her family while she is single, as her parents feel the need of her help, and also she hopes that the pig farm is more prosperous every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Kenguruka Group

texts.fr:
Dévote est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite la localité de Rutonde de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend les poules  depuis 10 ans, un métier qui l’oblige de faire des déplacements réguliers pour les revendre a Bujumbura, la Capitale. Elle était vendeuse de bananes avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Alphonse et ont ensemble 1 enfant de 10 ans qui étudie en 4e année primaire. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de beaucoup plus de poules  à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« KENGURUKA»
texts.en:
Devote is a 34-year-old merchant from the town of Rutonde in the country's central Gitega Province. She has been selling chickens for 10 years, a job that requires her to make regular trips to the capital Bujumbura, in order to sell them. She was a banana vendor before she started this activity.

She studied up to sixth grade. She is married to Alphonse and they are parents of a 10-year-old currently in fourth grade.

The Kiva loan of 120,000 Burundian francs allows her to increase her capital to buy many more chickens for resale, so she can realize large profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the "Kenguruka" community group.

loans.use: increase her working capital to buy more chickens for resale, so she can realize large profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Silvia Anabella

texts.es: Silvia Anabella.de 41 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo tiene 4 hijos dos mayores de edad y dos menores,y estan estudiando su primaria. ella tiene una venta de telas para confeccion,vende en el mercado de su comunidad tres veses a la semana, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas se vende,telas por mayor y tambien quiere inverti rn compra de huevos ya que recien empeso su venta de huvos,el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande donde axibir su mercaderia.y seguirles dando estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Silvia Anabella is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband. They have 4 children, two of them grown and two of them still minors in primary school. She sells fabric for sewing in the market of her community three times a week. She is asking for this loan to buy the fabric since this time of year is when she sells the most fabric wholesale. She also wants to invest in buying eggs, as she recently starting selling eggs. Her dream is to have a bigger locale to show her merchandise and keep giving her children an education.

loans.use: to sell fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn and fruit (papayas, apples, strawberries, peaches).

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La señora Mirtha es medico en un centro comunal y su esposo es carpintero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material médico para implementar un pequeño consultorio privado que está instalando, para mejorar su ingreso y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Vive en casa propia la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada  y  tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que Mirtha obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter emprendedor y las ventajas, ella desea que su crédito sea fondeado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Mirtha is a doctor in a community center and her husband’s a carpenter.  She needs the loan to buy medical equipment to set up a small private medical office to improve her income and help her husband with household expenses.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Llojeta zone; she’s married and has five children.  This is the first time Mirtha has gotten an IMPRO loan and because of its entrepreneurial nature and advantages, she wants it to be funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy medical equipment to set up a private doctor's office.

loans.name: Sisimukha Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha SHG Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, está nuevamente decidido por otro préstamo, ya que ha iniciado los preparativos en la tierra para la siembra de maiz, por lo que necesita insumos como abono y herbicidas, para el cultivo.
José está agradecido por este apoyo de microcréditos, ya que le permiten como agricultor y comerciante en pequeño, mejorar su trabajo y contribuir con su familia, el préstamo anterior le dio los productos necesarios para la tienda y logro pagarlo las cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan, as he has begun preparing his land for planting corn, and needs supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides for his crop.

José is thankful for this support in the form of microcredits. They allow him, as a farmer and small businessman, to do better work, and support his family. The previous loan gave him the products he needed for his store, and he succeeded in making his instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El señor  Rodrigo es productor lechero. Tiene un terreno en la localidad de Laja, donde habitan sus vacas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de comida para su ganado como ser afrecho polvillo de arroz y otros insumos. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de villa Copacabana  de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero  y no  tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Rodrigo is a dairy farmer.  He has a piece of land in Laja where his cows live.   He needs the loan to buy feed for his cattle like bran, rice powder and others.  This activity is the source of income he has to cover expenses.  He lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Copacabana zone.  He’s single and has no children.  This is the first time the client has obtained an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to buy feed for his dairy cattle.

loans.name: Bulala Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulala Group in Western Kenya! Paul is the facilitator of the Bulala group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Paul takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Paul will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bulala group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a un kiosco desde hace 8 años, el negocio está ubicado en una escuela, en donde todos los clientes son los estudiantes que asisten a este centro de estudio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pan, refrescos, golosinas, sándwich, sopas entre otros. Ella es una mujer responsable y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, a quienes con su esfuerzo y dedicación logro proporcionarles lo necesario.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora has had a kiosk for eight years. The business is located in a school, and all the customers are the students who attend this school.

The purpose of the loan is to buy bread, soft drinks, candy, sandwiches, soups and other merchandise.

She is a responsible woman and has two adult children. With her effort and dedication, she managed to provide them with the necessities of life.

loans.use: To buy bread, soft drinks, candy, sandwiches, soups and other merchandise.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, vive con su esposa y un hijo, tienen casa propia, y él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pipián, pepino y chile guaco, este oficio lo desarrolla desde hace 10 años, lo realiza todos los días de la semana, él aprendió por medio de su padre y hoy en día depende tanto él como su familia, de este cultivo.  
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos, abono y herbicidas, esta inversión le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario para la cosecha, con la esperanza de que tenga una buena produccion.
Su aspiración es ser un agricultor de éxito, obteniendo buenos resultados, con abundantes cosechas, y además ser un buen cliente con moral de pago en la institución.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his wife and a son, he has his own house, and he works growing corn, pipián fruit, cucumbers, chiles, and guaco plants. He has been doing this for 10 years. 

He works every day of the week. He learned from his father, and now his family depends on this crop. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. This loan will hep him to have everything he needs for the harvest, with the hope of having a good production.

His dream is to be a successful farmer, obtaining good results, with abundant  harvests, and to be a good client with a good payment history with the community bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Duo Estrellas Del Norte. Group

texts.es: Duo Estrellas del Norte. Este duo esta integrado por dos señoras las cuales tiene sus negocio y luchan para salir adelante,Una D. ellas es Olga judith D. 47 años D. edad ella tiene su venta D. refacciones desD. hace años.ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mercaderia para la elavoracion D. refacciones.al igual que la suguente socia esta solicitando su credito para la compra D. nercaderia para su negocio,y asi vender mas.el sueño D. ellas es agrandar mas su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Here is "Duo Estrellas del Norte." This duo is maD. up of two ladies who have businesses, and strive to get ahead. One of them is Olga Judith, 47. She has sold auto parts for some years. She is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise used for auto repairs. 

In the same way, the other member is applying for her loan to buy merchandise for her business, so she can sell more.  Their dream is to expand their respective businesses to improve their earnings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise used for auto repairs.

loans.name: Wesakulila Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila SHG Group in Western Kenya! Janet is the facilitator of the Wesakulila SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janet takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janet had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janet was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Janet will invest in livestock rearing and pay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es: La señora Glenda trabaja en una tienda de ventas de artículos para damas y además es pintora y pinta cuadros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil, una mesa de dibujo, una impresora y materiales para sus pinturas; así será más eficiente su trabajo. Vive en  casa en alquiler la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la segunda vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también la segunda vez que se fondea a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Glenda works in a store that sells women’s items but she’s also an artist; she paints.  She needs the loan to buy a laptop computer, a drawing table, a printer and supplies for her painting so that her work will be more efficient.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Achumani zone; she’s single and has no children.  This is the second time she’s gotten an IMPRO loan and also the second time it’s funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a drawing table, a printer and supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene su negocio que es la venta de llantas y repuestos para vehículos. Tiene más de 4 años en su negocio, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se encuentra muy contento de tener esta oportunidad. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de llantas, sistema de amortiguación, aceites, parachoques, radiadores entre otros. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y al mismo tiempo seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco José has a business selling tires and vehicle parts. He has been in his business for more than four years. This is not the first time that he has taken out loans, so he is very happy to have this opportunity.  

He is applying for the loan in order to buy tires, shock absorbers, oil, bumpers, radiators, and other things. He dreams of expanding his business, and continuing to move forward.

loans.use: To buy tires, shock absorbers, oil, bumpers, radiators and other things.

loans.name: Fumbatukha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Fumbatukha Group in Western Kenya! Martin is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Martin will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Fumbatukha group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, solicita nuevamente un préstamo porque está motivado por seguir cultivando maíz y yuca, pues dispone de terreno para hacerlo producir, él comprara insumos como el abono, que es tan necesario para la producción y el crecimiento del cultivo. El préstamo anterior le permitió tener su buena cosecha, pago a tiempo la deuda y por eso desea continuar trabajando con la institución.
La condición familiar de Cruz está cambiando, debido al buen trabajo que realiza, por el momento disponen de parte de la cosecha para alimentarse.
texts.en:
Cruz is again applying for a loan, because he wants to continue planting corn and yuca, as he has land that he can farm. 

He will buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, which is so necessary for the growth and output of these crops. The previous loan allowed him to have a good harvest. 

Cruz paid his debt on time, and that is why he wishes to continue working with the institution. His family's standard of living is improving; due to his good work, for the time being they have part of the harvest to live on.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Cristian Del Socorro

texts.es: Cristian Del Socorro es una mujer que se dedica a trabajar en un centro de salud. El financiamiento que solicita será enfocado en la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, clavos, pega. Pues no había podido realizar estas mejoras que son necesarias porque no tenía el capital suficiente. Ella es una mujer trabajadora debido a las lluvias es que ha presentado este problema en su vivienda. El sueña con agrandar su vivienda y acondicionarla mejor.
texts.en: Cristian Del Socorro is a woman who works in a health center.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials such as zinc, nails, and mortar. She has not been able to make these improvements because she did not have enough money.  She is a hardworking woman and has this problem with her home due to the rain.  Her dream is to expand her home and improve its condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like zinc, nails, and mortar.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 12 años de edad, Carlos se dedica al negocio desde hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para tener disponibilidad económica, porque su negocio trata de salir por varios pueblos de la zona para comprar en los hogares hierro, cobre, latas, y todo tipo de chatarra, para luego venderla a los lugares donde las recolectan, este préstamo le ayudara para tener dinero disponible para comprar y realizar sus ventas normales.
La aspiración de Carlos es tener disponibilidad económica, para poder darle continuidad al negocio y aumentar los ingresos al hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos has a business buying and selling scrap metal.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 5 and 12.  Carlos has had this business for 5 years.  He works every day from 6am to 4pm.  

He is requesting this loan to have available cash, because his business involves traveling to various towns in the area to purchase iron, copper, cans, and all types of scrap metal at people's homes, and then selling it at recycling centers.  This loan will help him have available cash to make his normal purchases and sales.   

Carlos aspires to have available funds to be able to continue with his business and increase his household income.

loans.use: to purchase iron, copper, cans, and scrap metal.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
